title.narrative: 5.2 FINANCIAL RESOURCES AND STEWARDSHIP

description.narrative: This Intermediate Results (IR) will cover management of financial and other assets of the organ ization, including activities and costs associated with office administr ation, corresponding to the Biennial Support Budget functions at country level covered under Functions 10 and 12, including the salaries and rel ated non-staff costs of Administration and Finance, rent, office furnitu re and equipment, office security, maintenance and vehicles, which contributes to Field Office Oversight, Management And Operations Support, Field/Country Office Oversight, Management And Operations Support. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Effective and efficient programme management and Operations support

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: This IR will cover management of financial and other assets of the organ ization, including activities and costs associated withoffice administr ation, corresponding to the Biennial Support Budget functions at country level covered under Functions 10 and 12,including the salaries and rel ated non-staff costs of Administration and Finance, rent, office furnitu re and equipment, officesecurity, maintenance and vehicles

description.narrative: The CO has put especial emphasis in ensuring the best use of financial resources through HACT, monitoring of DCT and programme implementation. | Status:Met | As-of Date:27/01/2019

title.narrative: BCP updated to include a change in the safe haven and a communications systems test

target.value: 2014:New safe haven identified and BCP approved by the CMT

actual.value: 2018:BCP document was updated, considering the new technologic platforms (OneDrive, ECM. ICT Light environment).

title.narrative: ERM updated to include current financial and new operational conditions

actual.value: 2018:The Risk Countrol and Self Assessment-RCSA was updated early 2017, using a participatory approach with the involvement of all staff members, based on the existing methodology.

title.narrative: Operational processes and procedures aligned with the reduced Operations Section designed.

target.value: 2014:CMT and Panama hub approval, SLA signed for joining into the hub

title.narrative: Reviewed structure of the Operations Section including the alternative of joining a Hub prepared and submitted for the PBR evaluation.
Aligned roles mapping and structure of accountabilities approved by the CMT.

actual.value: 2018:The Table of Authorities is fully updated taking into account the new eZHact accountability framework.

title.narrative: As part of the savings efforts, a) a plan for the rationalization in the use of energy implemented, and b) efficient parameters for the administration of supplies and PP&E implemented

baseline.value: Energy audit conducted in 2012 and PP&E and supplies by the amount of US$ 300,000 stored in the warehouse

title.narrative: Plan for the transition to the new Operations Section structure prepared and reviewed by the CMT, which includes a matching reorganization or transfer of selected functions.

actual.value: 2018:The CO has recovered its strategic advisory and technical capacity with the creation of the Operations Officer post. The Operations Section is now ready to successfully receive the functions from the Multi-Country Support Framework-MCSF.
